variable.name: dm_inc
variable.description: Incident diabetes indicator
variable.comment: Variable created specifically for GENEVA. Documentation regarding the source for this variable is not available.

variable.name: futimedm
variable.description: Follow-up time for incident diabetes
variable.comment: An interpolated time to diabetes variable using information about glucose levels at the last visit without diabetes and the first visit at which the participant is classified as diabetic. Variable created specifically for GENEVA. Documentation regarding the source for this variable is not available.

variable.name: dmleft
variable.description: Time to last visit without diabetes
variable.comment: Because diabetes was detected only at visits, the most appropriate way to use time to incident diabetes is as an interval censored variable. DMLEFT and DMRIGHT define the interval. Variable created specifically for GENEVA. Documentation regarding the source for this variable is not available.

variable.name: dmright
variable.description: Time to first visit with diabetes
variable.comment: Because diabetes was detected only at visits, the most appropriate way to use time to incident diabetes is as an interval censored variable. DMLEFT and DMRIGHT define the interval. Variable created specifically for GENEVA. Documentation regarding the source for this variable is not available.
variable.value: Diabetes not developed in the course of follow-up

variable.name: dmvisit

variable.comment: Variable created specifically for GENEVA. Documentation regarding the source for this variable is not available.

variable.name: dm_class

variable.comment: Variable created specifically for GENEVA. Documentation regarding the source for this variable is not available.

variable.name: anksbp13

variable.name: armsbp13
variable.description: Redefined supine brachial SBP [systolic blood pressure] at visit 1

variable.name: abi04
variable.description: Ankle-brachial index at visit 1, (Definition 4)
variable.comment: At the ARIC [The Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities] examination visits arm and ankle systolic blood pressures were measured on resting subjects using the Dinamap 1846 SX. Brachial artery systolic pressures were measured in the right arm every five minutes during the carotid ultrasound examination. Posterior tibial artery systolic pressures were measured two times 5 to 8 minutes apart in one randomly selected leg. The ABI was calculated by dividing the average of the two ankle pressure measurements by the average of the first two brachial pressure readings (1, 2). The correlation between the duplicate blood pressure readings was 0.92 in the leg and 0.90 in the arm. The mean absolute difference between the duplicate readings was 0.5 mmHg (95% confidence interval (CI) 0.3-0.6) in the leg and 3.0 mmHg (95% CI 2.8-3.2) in the arm. Presence or absence of (PAD) was defined as an ABI less than 0.90 in men and less than 0.85 in women.

variable.name: lopawa45
variable.description: Weight for derived average far wall thickness (L opt)
variable.comment: The weights are fractions (proportion of sites, out of 6, available for the calculations, so the values correspond to 1/6, 2/6, 3/6, 4/6, 5/6, 6/6). They are a measure of precision. Regression models using the ultrasound measurements as dependent variables will usually be more precise if weighted regression is used.

variable.description: Ankle-brachial index at visit 3, (Definition 4)
variable.comment: At the ARIC [The Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities] examination visits arm and ankle systolic blood pressures were measured on resting subjects using the Dinamap 1846 SX. Brachial artery systolic pressures were measured in the right arm every five minutes during the carotid ultrasound examination. Posterior tibial artery systolic pressures were measured two times 5 to 8 minutes apart in one randomly selected leg. The ABI was calculated by dividing the average of the two ankle pressure measurements by the average of the first two brachial pressure readings (1, 2). The correlation between the duplicate blood pressure readings was 0.92 in the leg and 0.90 in the arm. The mean absolute difference between the duplicate readings was 0.5 mmHg (95% confidence interval (CI) 0.3-0.6) in the leg and 3.0 mmHg (95% CI 2.8-3.2) in the arm. Presence or absence of (PAD) was defined as an ABI less than 0.90 in men and less than 0.85 in women.

variable.name: abi44
variable.description: Ankle-brachial index at visit 4, (Definition 4)
variable.comment: At the ARIC [The Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities] examination visits arm and ankle systolic blood pressures were measured on resting subjects using the Dinamap 1846 SX. Brachial artery systolic pressures were measured in the right arm every five minutes during the carotid ultrasound examination. Posterior tibial artery systolic pressures were measured two times 5 to 8 minutes apart in one randomly selected leg. The ABI was calculated by dividing the average of the two ankle pressure measurements by the average of the first two brachial pressure readings (1, 2). The correlation between the duplicate blood pressure readings was 0.92 in the leg and 0.90 in the arm. The mean absolute difference between the duplicate readings was 0.5 mmHg (95% confidence interval (CI) 0.3-0.6) in the leg and 3.0 mmHg (95% CI 2.8-3.2) in the arm. Presence or absence of (PAD) was defined as an ABI less than 0.90 in men and less than 0.85 in women.
